Description.div: Shipping charge calculation user exit input. Order prices without shipping.
Currency in which the prices are returned.
Indicates the Customer ID on which behalf pricing inquiry is made.
The EnterpriseCode on which behalf pricing inquiry is being made.
The price of the order before shipping and order adjustments. It is sum of LinePrice from all non information lines in the order.
Sum of adjustments obtained by pricing order total rules and coupons.
The OrderReference is the Order Header Key.
Pricing is being checked on behalf of the organization specified by OrganizationCode.
Date on which the pricing is requested.
The price of the order before shipping adjustments. Subtotal = LinePriceTotal + OrderAdjustment.
Indicates whether the rule execution is suppressed or not.

Attributes of customer used for selecting the pricing entities. If this element is not passed and CustomerID is passed then the attributes of the customer are defaulted from the customer's profile. Defaulting of PersonInfo from the customer's profile for different customer type is as below:
Type of Customer Default for PersonInfo
Business Default sold to address, if void then default bill to address.
Consumer Default bill to address.
Anonymous No defaults.
The level of a customer with the enterprise.

Type of customer. If neither CustomerID nor CustomerType are passed then CustomerType is defaulted to 03 .
If not void then CustomerType must be one of the allowed values.

The region of the customer. If RegionKey is void then PersonInfo element is used to determine region of the customer. If both RegionKey and PersonInfo are not void then RegionKey takes precedence over PersonInfo to determine region of the customer.
If not void then RegionKey should be a valid region within the region schema that is configured for purpose SELLING .
The type of the relationship that exists between an organization and an enterprise.
Vertical of the customer.
Address of the customer.
Adjustment passed as part of this manual rule.
Primary key of the manual rule.
Name of the manual rule.

Indicates the status of the manual rule validation and application on the order. Following table lists the possible status codes:
StatusMsgCode Description Attributes returned
YPM_RULE_VALID The manual rule is valid. None
YPM_RULE_INVALID The manual rule does not exist. None
YPM_RULE_NOT_ACTIVE The manual rule is not active.
PricingStatus of the manual rule
YPM_RULE_NOT_YET_EFFECTIVE The manual rule is not yet active.
StartDateActive of the manual rule
YPM_RULE_EXPIRED The manual rule is expired.
EndDateActive of the manual rule
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER The manual rule is not assigned to the CustomerID
CustomerID passed in the input. A blank CustomerID indicates that the manual rule has no assignments with void CustomerID for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_REGION The manual rule is not assigned to the passed RegionKey or PersonInfo
RegionKey passed or derived based on PersonInfo from the input. A blank RegionKey indicates that the manual rule has no assignments with void RegionKey for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_ATTRIBUTE The manual rule is not assigned to the passed customer attribute Any one of the input CustomerType, RelationshipType, Vertical or any extended attribute of the YPM_PRICING_RULE_ASSIGNMENT that didn't match the manual rule assignments. A blank attribute value indicates that the manual rule has no assignments with void value for the SelectionCriteria of that customer attribute.
YPM_RULE_ADJUSTMENT_NOT_VALID The adjustment specified in the input is not valid for the applicable manual rule action. The reason can be any one of the below:
Adjustment is not passed or passed adjustment is null and the applicable manual rule action doesn't have any default adjustment (Adjustment on the manual rule action) specified.
The maximum allowed manual adjustment (MaximumManualAdjustment on the manual rule action) on the applicable manual rule action is null and the passed adjustment is not equal to the default adjustment.
if action is supposed to produce a discount and the condition ( 0 >= Passed adjustment >= MaximumManualAdjustment of the applicable manual rule action ) is false.
if action is supposed to produce a uplift and the condition ( 0 <= Passed adjustment <= MaximumManualAdjustment of the applicable manual rule action ) is false.
Attributes of the applicable manual rule action are returned.
YPM_RULE_TARGET_SKU_MISSING The item on which this manual rule applies adjustments does not exist in this order
TargetItemID and TargetUnitOfMeasure of the manual rule.
YPM_RULE_CONDITION_NOT_SATISFIED The manual rule condition is not satisfied. Hence the rule is not fired. None.
YPM_RULE_NOT_APPLIED Even though the manual rule is valid and condition is satisfied the manual rule is not applied. None.
YPM_RULE_NOT_APPLICABLE The manual rule is not applicable. For example an order total rule is passed at line level. None.
Name of the attribute on the manual rule or in the input due to which the manual rule is not applicable.
Value of the attribute.
The manual rule adjustment that is applicable.
The default adjustment available as part of this manual rule.
Maximum possible adjustment applicable as part of this manual rule.
A specific PriceTypeName associated with the applicable manual rule.
Action of the manual rule that is applicable.
The manual adjustment, coupon or pricing rule which has resulted in this adjustment.
Total adjustment applied as because of pricing rule or coupon or the manual adjustment.
Total adjustment applicable because of pricing rule or coupon or manual adjustment.

The identifier of an adjustment.
Possible Values:
PricingRuleName - If adjustment has occurred because of a pricing rule.
CouponID - If adjustment has occurred because of a coupon.
AdjustmentID - Manual adjustment identifier provided in the input.
Quantity of items to which this adjustment is applicable.

For header level free gift promotions, indicates free gift quantity that may still be applied. If StatusMsgCode is YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_NOT_SELECTED but AwardQuantity is not present, then applicable quantity is unspecified.
The charge category. This attribute is used in the input of YPMOverrideGetOrderPrice User Exit.
The name of the charge. This attribute is used in the input of YPMOverrideGetOrderPrice User Exit.
Indicates whether the adjustment is manual or not.

Used by user exit to add a new manual adjustment to the order, or remove an existing manual adjustment from the order.
Valid Values:
ADD - Adds a new manual adjustment to the order.
REMOVE - Removes an existing adjustment from the order
The default behavior is ADD .

Indicates the status of the rule validation and application on the order. Following table lists the possible status codes:
YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_NOT_SELECTED Free gift was not selected or only partially selected for rule. AwardQuantity attribute indicates the free gift quantity that can be applied for this rule. None.
Coupon identifier.
Action of the pricing rule which is performed to generate the adjustment.

Attribute.Name: Carrier
Attribute.Description: The carrier assigned to the order. This is a pass through field available to user exits..

Description.div: Shipping charge for the order.
Absolute uplift or discount on the ListPrice.
The delivery method for the order line.
Indicates that the order line is eligible for shipping charge discounts.
The price for this order line before any rule adjustments are accounted for. ExtendedPrice = UnitPrice * Quantity.
Indicates whether the order line price is for information only.
Indicates whether the UnitPrice for the order line is locked or not.
Item identifier.
Sum of manual adjustments and adjustments generated by item targeted rules and coupons.
Unique identifier for the line.
The price of the line. LinePrice = ExtendedPrice + LineAdjustment.
List price of an unit of order line item.
Total adjustments applied on this order line because of order total rule or coupon distribution.
Percent uplift or discount on the ListPrice.
The quantity of item associated with the order line.
The unit of measure of the item.
Price of an unit of order line item. UnitPrice is computed from ListPrice , AbsoluteAdjustment and PercentAdjsutment, UnitPrice = ListPrice * ( 1 + PercentAdjustment / 100) + AbsoluteAdjustment.
Adjustment passed as part of this manual rule.
Primary key of the manual rule.
Name of the manual rule.

Indicates the status of the manual rule validation and application on the order. Following table lists the possible status codes:
StatusMsgCode Description Attributes returned
YPM_RULE_VALID The manual rule is valid. None
YPM_RULE_INVALID The manual rule does not exist. None
YPM_RULE_NOT_ACTIVE The manual rule is not active.
PricingStatus of the manual rule
YPM_RULE_NOT_YET_EFFECTIVE The manual rule is not yet active.
StartDateActive of the manual rule
YPM_RULE_EXPIRED The manual rule is expired.
EndDateActive of the manual rule
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER The manual rule is not assigned to the CustomerID
CustomerID passed in the input. A blank CustomerID indicates that the manual rule has no assignments with void CustomerID for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_REGION The manual rule is not assigned to the passed RegionKey or PersonInfo
RegionKey passed or derived based on PersonInfo from the input. A blank RegionKey indicates that the manual rule has no assignments with void RegionKey for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_ATTRIBUTE The manual rule is not assigned to the passed customer attribute Any one of the input CustomerType, RelationshipType, Vertical or any extended attribute of the YPM_PRICING_RULE_ASSIGNMENT that didn't match the manual rule assignments. A blank attribute value indicates that the manual rule has no assignments with void value for the SelectionCriteria of that customer attribute.
YPM_RULE_ADJUSTMENT_NOT_VALID The adjustment specified in the input is not valid for the applicable manual rule action. The reason can be any one of the below:
Adjustment is not passed or passed adjustment is null and the applicable manual rule action doesn't have any default adjustment (Adjustment on the manual rule action) specified.
The maximum allowed manual adjustment (MaximumManualAdjustment on the manual rule action) on the applicable manual rule action is null and the passed adjustment is not equal to the default adjustment.
if action is supposed to produce a discount and the condition ( 0 >= Passed adjustment >= MaximumManualAdjustment of the applicable manual rule action ) is false.
if action is supposed to produce a uplift and the condition ( 0 <= Passed adjustment <= MaximumManualAdjustment of the applicable manual rule action ) is false.
Attributes of the applicable manual rule action are returned.
YPM_RULE_TARGET_SKU_MISSING The item on which this manual rule applies adjustments does not exist in this order
TargetItemID and TargetUnitOfMeasure of the manual rule.
YPM_RULE_CONDITION_NOT_SATISFIED The manual rule condition is not satisfied. Hence the rule is not fired. None.
YPM_RULE_NOT_APPLIED Even though the manual rule is valid and condition is satisfied the manual rule is not applied. None.
YPM_RULE_NOT_APPLICABLE The manual rule is not applicable. For example an order total rule is passed at line level. None.
Name of the attribute on the manual rule or in the input due to which the manual rule is not applicable.
Value of the attribute.
The manual rule adjustment that is applicable.
The default adjustment available as part of this manual rule.
Default adjustment for every unit of line item.
Unique identifier for the line.
Maximum possible adjustment applicable as part of this manual rule.
Adjustment for every unit of line item.
A specific PriceTypeName associated with the applicable manual rule.
Action of the manual rule that is applicable.
The manual adjustment, coupon or pricing rule which has resulted in this adjustment.
Total adjustment applied as because of pricing rule or coupon or the manual adjustment.
Total adjustment applicable because of pricing rule or coupon or manual adjustment.

The identifier of an adjustment.
Possible Values:
PricingRuleName - If adjustment has occurred because of a pricing rule.
CouponID - If adjustment has occurred because of a coupon.
AdjustmentID - Manual adjustment identifier provided in the input.
Adjustment for the line.
Deprecated. Use AdjustmentApplied attribute instead. Adjustment for every unit of line item.
Quantity of items to which this adjustment is applicable.

For header level free gift promotions, indicates free gift quantity that may still be applied. If StatusMsgCode is YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_NOT_SELECTED but AwardQuantity is not present, then applicable quantity is unspecified.
The charge category. This attribute is used in the input of YPMOverrideGetOrderPrice User Exit.
The name of the charge. This attribute is used in the input of YPMOverrideGetOrderPrice User Exit.
Indicates whether the adjustment is manual or not.

Used by user exit to add a new manual adjustment to the order, or remove an existing manual adjustment from the order.
Valid Values:
ADD - Adds a new manual adjustment to the order.
REMOVE - Removes an existing adjustment from the order
The default behavior is ADD .
Prorated Adjustment for the line.
Actual quantity used for the Prorated adjustment

Indicates the status of the rule validation and application on the order. Following table lists the possible status codes:
YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_NOT_SELECTED Free gift was not selected or only partially selected for rule. AwardQuantity attribute indicates the free gift quantity that can be applied for this rule. None.
Coupon identifier.
List of qualifier lines for the adjustment
The ID of the qualifier line

This attribute in input of overrideGetOrderPriceUE identifies the participating quantity of the corresponding LineID, which was responsible for triggering and applying a system pricing rule. Note that this is a derived (and approximate ) field which serves as an indication, and should not be considered as definitive trigger quantity.
Action of the pricing rule which is performed to generate the adjustment.
The manual adjustment, coupon or pricing rule which has resulted in this adjustment.
Total adjustment applied as because of pricing rule or coupon or the manual adjustment.
Total adjustment applicable because of pricing rule or coupon or manual adjustment.

The identifier of an adjustment.
Possible Values:
PricingRuleName - If adjustment has occurred because of a pricing rule.
CouponID - If adjustment has occurred because of a coupon.
AdjustmentID - Manual adjustment identifier provided in the input.
Quantity of items to which this adjustment is applicable.

For header level free gift promotions, indicates free gift quantity that may still be applied. If StatusMsgCode is YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_NOT_SELECTED but AwardQuantity is not present, then applicable quantity is unspecified.
The charge category. This attribute is used in the input of YPMOverrideGetOrderPrice User Exit.
The name of the charge. This attribute is used in the input of YPMOverrideGetOrderPrice User Exit.
Indicates whether the adjustment is manual or not.

Used by user exit to add a new manual adjustment to the order, or remove an existing manual adjustment from the order.
Valid Values:
ADD - Adds a new manual adjustment to the order.
REMOVE - Removes an existing adjustment from the order
The default behavior is ADD .

Indicates the status of the rule validation and application on the order. Following table lists the possible status codes:
YPM_RULE_FREE_GIFT_NOT_SELECTED Free gift was not selected or only partially selected for rule. AwardQuantity attribute indicates the free gift quantity that can be applied for this rule. None.
Coupon identifier.
Action of the pricing rule which is performed to generate the adjustment.
Pricelist line selected for calculating UnitPrice.
ChildPricelistHeaderKey is the PricelistHeaderKey of inherited price list.

UnitPrice is computed from ListPrice , AbsoluteAdjustment and PercentAdjsutment. Formula to calculate UnitPrice is as follows.
UnitPrice = ListPrice * (1+PercentAdjustment/100) + AbsoluteAdjustment

Unique identifier of a coupon.
CouponID is not passed.

Indicates the status of the coupon validation and application on the order. Following table lists the possible coupon status codes:
CouponStatusMsgCode Description Coupon Status Attributes returned
YPM_RULE_APPLIED The coupon is applied. None
YPM_RULE_INVALID The coupon does not exist. None
YPM_RULE_PARTIAL The coupon is partially valid. None
YPM_RULE_NOT_ACTIVE The coupon is not active.
PricingStatus of the coupon
YPM_RULE_NOT_YET_EFFECTIVE The coupon is not yet active.
StartDateActive of the coupon
YPM_RULE_EXPIRED The coupon is expired.
EndDateActive of the coupon
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER The coupon is not assigned to the CustomerID
CustomerID passed in the input. A blank CustomerID indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void CustomerID for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER_CONTACT The coupon is not assigned to the CustomerContactID
CustomerContactID passed in the input. A blank CustomerContactID indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void CustomerContactID for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_NOT_ASSIGNED_TO_SELLER The coupon is not assigned to the SellerOrganizationCode
SellerOrganizationCode passed in the input. A blank SellerOrganizationCode indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void SellerOrganizationCode for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_REGION The coupon is not assigned to the passed RegionKey or PersonInfo
RegionKey passed or derived based on PersonInfo from the input. A blank RegionKey indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void RegionKey for the SelectionCriteria.
YPM_RULE_BAD_ATTRIBUTE The coupon is not assigned to the passed customer attribute Any one of the input CustomerType, RelationshipType, Vertical or any extended attribute of the YPM_PRICING_RULE_ASSIGNMENT that didn't match the coupon assignments. A blank attribute value indicates that the coupon has no assignments with void value for the SelectionCriteria of that customer attribute.
YPM_RULE_TARGET_SKU_MISSING The item on which this coupon applies adjustments does not exist in this order
TargetItemID and TargetUnitOfMeasure of the coupon.
YPM_RULE_BAD_MIN_NO_OF_SHIPMENTS This coupon does not apply as the MinimizeNumberOfShipments flag on the coupon does not match of that in the order.
MinimizeNumberOfShipments flag of the rule associated with the coupon.
YPM_RULE_BAD_SHIP_METHOD This coupon does not apply as the CarrierServiceCode does not match that of the order.
CarrierServiceCode of the rule associated with the coupon.
YPM_RULE_EXCLUSIVE_COUPON_ORDER This is an exclusive coupon. Another coupon has already applied adjustments on the coupons' target*.
CouponID that's already applied.
YPM_RULE_EXCLUSIVE_COUPON_ALREADY_ORDER An exclusive coupon has already applied adjustments on the coupon's target*.
CouponID that's already applied.
YPM_RULE_CONDITION_NOT_SATISFIED The coupon condition is not satisfied. Hence the rule is not fired. None.
YPM_RULE_NOT_APPLIED Even though the coupon is valid and condition is satisfied the coupon is not applied. For example: The coupon is providing a flat fee that is greater than the shipping charge of the order. None.
YPM_RULE_NOT_APPLICABLE The coupon is not applicable. For example a coupon is passed and it is not applicable when RunCatalogOnlyRules is set to Y . None.
YPM_RULE_BAD_PAYMENT_METHOD The coupon is not applicable to the passed PaymentTypein PaymentTypeList from the input.
PaymentType passed in PaymentTypeList from the input.
*A item targeted coupon is exclusive with another item targeted coupon only, it is not exclusive with an order total coupon. The exclusivity is also is similar for an order total coupon.
Indicates whether the coupon is exclusive or not.
Indicates whether the coupon is an item rule or not.

Attribute.Name: Valid
Attribute.Description: Indicates whether the coupon is valid or not. This does not indicate whether the coupon is applicable or not. Refer to CouponStatusMsgCode to determine whether the coupon is applicable or not. Refer to the validateCoupon API for details on how a coupon is determined to be valid. If ValidateReferences was 'Y' the value for this attribute can be Y|N|P. The value 'P' means that the references for coupon are partially valid. Some of the references are valid and some of them are not.

Description.div: Name of the attribute on the coupon or in the input due to which the coupon is not applicable.
Value of the attribute.

Indicates the status of the reference validation. Following table lists the possible reference status codes:
CouponStatusMsgCode Description Coupon Status Attributes returned
YPM_CODE_VALID The reference is valid. None
YPM_CODE_INVALID The reference does not exist. None
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER The reference is not assigned to the CustomerID
None
YPM_RULE_BAD_CUSTOMER_CONTACT The reference is not assigned to the CustomerContactID
None
Indicates whether the reference is valid or not. Valid values are Y|N
Name of the attribute on the coupon or in the input due to which the coupon is not applicable.
Value of the attribute.
